content:
I'm using the rowan library in a different application. It's really great, thanks for factoring it out. In my program, I'm doing some syntax transformations for various reasons. I initially reached for SyntaxNode::replace_with, but it asserts that the replacement must have the same kind() as the original node. Is there any particular reasoning behind this? I can't think of a reason why it wouldn't be valid to change to a different SyntaxKind as part of a node replacement.

I changed over to using splice_children to delete and replace the node in question, and that seems to work fine.
